title: WCAS LING 250-0-20 Sound Patterns in Human Language
class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Linguistics 250 is an introduction to the sound structure of language. We will learn to describe speech sounds in the three domains of speech: the articulatory domain (how speech sounds are produced in the human vocal tract), the acoustic domain (their form in the acoustic medium), and the perceptual domain (how listeners process the incoming speech signal). We will learn to recognize the ways in which speech sounds pattern in language to convey meaning, and the ways in which these patterns are similar and different across the languages of the world. Finally, we will learn about current speech technology as it applies to computerized speech synthesis and speech recognition.
